newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-ANZ cuts variable mortgage rate.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-ANZ cuts variable mortgage rate.

text.p: The Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd (ANZ) said on Friday that it would cut its standard variable mortgage rate to 7.2 percent from 7.55 percent.

ANZ, the second of the big four private banks to cut its rates since the Reserve Bank eased monetary policy earlier on Thursday, said the new mortgage rate would be available to new customers from May 26 and to existing customers on July 21.
It said it had not changed its no-frills mortgage rate of 6.5 percent. The bank also said it planned to cut its business rates next week when an announcement would be made.
Commonwealth Bank of Australia earlier lowered its standard rate by a similar 35 basis points to 7.20 percent and eased its no-frills rate to 6.7 percent from 6.95 percent.
Westpac Banking Corp and National Australia Bank Ltd have not yet announced any changes to their interest rate structures. Their standard variable mortgage rate stands at 7.55 percent.
The central bank said it would cut the official cash rate by 50 basis points to 5.5 percent, citing low inflation and the outlook for stronger growth.
